messages.content: What did the zero say to the eight?
Nice belt!
Why was the math book looking sad?
Because it had too many problems.
What’s the best tool for math?
Multi-pliers.
Why do we rarely talk to circles?
Because there’s no point.
What do you call a number that can’t keep still?
A roamin’ numeral.
Why was the equal sign so happy?
Because it found its balance.
Why do plants hate math?
Because it gives them square roots.
What do you get if you divide the circumference of a jack-o’-lantern by its diameter?
Pumpkin π.
Why do math professors love parks?
Because of the natural logs.
What do you call a group of men waiting for a haircut?
A barberqueue.
Why are obtuse angles so depressed?
Because they’re never right.
Why can’t you trust math?
Because it’s always plotting something.
What’s a mathematician’s favorite type of tree?
Geometry.
Why was six afraid of seven in Europe?
Because seven eight nine.
What do you call a snake who works for the government?
A civil serpent.
Why do algebra problems look so sad?
Because they’re always dealing with their x.
What do you call a retired math teacher?
A calculator.
How do you make seven even?
Remove the s.
What did algebra math book say to the calculus book?
Don't bother me I've got my own problems!
What do you call a mathematician who’s afraid of negative numbers?
A number chicken.
Why did the student do multiplication problems on the floor?
The teacher told him not to use tables.
What’s clear and used by a math teacher?
Transparent pi.
Why did the two 4s skip lunch?
Because they already 8.
What’s a math teacher’s favorite sum?
Summer!
Why was the math book always worried?
Because it had too many problems.
How do mathematicians cure constipation?
They work it out with a pencil.
What did the algebra book say to the calculus book?
What’s your problem?
Why was the equal sign so humble?
Because it knew it wasn’t less than or greater than anyone else.
What do you call a man who spent all summer at the beach?
A tangent.
What do you call a broken calculator?
A math malfunction.
Why do plants hate math?
It gives them square roots.
What do you call a snake that’s 3.14 meters long?
A πthon.
Why was the geometry book sad?
Because it had too many problems.
What do you call a teapot of boiling water on top of Mount Everest?
A high-pot-in-use.
Why don’t mathematicians argue in bars?
Because beer goggles give them fuzzy logic.
What do you call a number that can’t keep still?
A roamin’ numeral.
Why did the student get upset when his teacher called him average?
It was a mean thing to say.
Why are parallel lines so tragic?
They’ll never meet.
What do you call a group of people waiting to talk to an artificial intelligence?
A chat queue.
Why did the algorithm go to therapy?
It had too many loops.
